TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Pop3Client extends System.Object implements class MailKit.IMessageService, class MailKit.IMessageSpool, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class MimeKit.MimeMessage>, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: A POP3 client that can be used to retrieve messages from a server.
Docs.remarks: The class supports both the "pop3" and "pop3s" protocols. The "pop3" protocol makes a clear-text connection to the POP3 server and does not use SSL or TLS unless the POP3 server supports the STLS extension (as defined by rfc2595). The "pop3s" protocol, however, connects to the POP3 server using an SSL-wrapped connection.

MemberSignature.Value: public Pop3Client ();
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Docs.remarks: Before you can retrieve messages with the , you must first call the method and authenticate with the method.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Authenticate (System.Net.ICredentials credentials, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Authenticate(class System.Net.ICredentials credentials, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

Docs.summary: Authenticates using the supplied credentials.

remarks.para: If the POP3 server supports the APOP authentication mechanism, then APOP is used.

If the APOP authentication mechanism is not supported and the server supports one or more SASL authentication mechanisms, then the SASL mechanisms that both the client and server support are tried in order of greatest security to weakest security. Once a SASL authentication mechanism is found that both client and server support, the credentials are used to authenticate.
If the server does not support SASL or if no common SASL mechanisms can be found, then the USER and PASS commands are used as a fallback.

Docs.exception: The is not connected or is already authenticated.
The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
Authentication using the supplied credentials has failed.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.HashSet<string> AuthenticationMechanisms { get; }
.property instance class System.Collections.Generic.HashSet`1<string> AuthenticationMechanisms

Docs.summary: Gets the authentication mechanisms supported by the POP3 server.

remarks.para: The authentication mechanisms are queried durring the method.
Servers that do not support the SASL capability will typically support either the "APOP" authentication mechanism () or the ability to login using the "USER" and "PASS" commands ().

.property instance valuetype MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Capabilities Capabilities

Docs.summary: Gets the capabilities supported by the POP3 server.
Docs.remarks: The capabilities will not be known until a successful connection has been made via the method and may change as a side-effect of the method.

.property instance class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509CertificateCollection ClientCertificates

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the client SSL certificates.

remarks.para: Some servers may require the client SSL certificates in order to allow the user to connect.
This property should be set before calling .

MemberSignature.Value: public void Connect (Uri uri, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Connect(class System.Uri uri, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

Docs.param: The server URI. The should either be "pop3" to make a clear-text connection or "pop3s" to make an SSL connection.
Docs.summary: Establishes a connection to the specified POP3 server.
Docs.remarks:
Establishes a connection to an POP3 or POP3/S server. If the schema in the uri is "pop3", a clear-text connection is made and defaults to using port 110 if no port is specified in the URI. However, if the schema in the uri is "pop3s", an SSL connection is made using the and defaults to port 995 unless a port is specified in the URI.
It should be noted that when using a clear-text POP3 connection, if the server advertizes support for the STLS extension, the client will automatically switch into TLS mode before authenticating. If a successful connection is made, the and properties will be populated.
Docs.exception: The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Dispose ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed

Docs.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.
Docs.remarks: Call when you are finished using the . The method leaves the in an unusable state. After calling , you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying.

MemberSignature.Value: public int ExpirePolicy { get; }
.property instance int32 ExpirePolicy

Docs.summary: Gets the expiration policy.

remarks.para: If the server supports the EXPIRE capability (), the value of the property will reflect the value advertized by the server.
A value of -1 indicates that messages will never expire.
A value of 0 indicates that messages that have been retrieved during the current session will be purged immediately after the connection is closed via the "QUIT" command.
Values larger than 0 indicate the minimum number of days that the server will retain messages which have been retrieved.
